customer_addr:
1010 Delta Boulevard
ATG 109 - OC1, 4TH FLOOR
Atlanta, GA 30354

citations.narrative:
Delta Airlines personnel reported to a Los Angeles County Public Health Veterinarian (LACPHV) on March 8, 2024, that 2
Amazon parrots, listed on AWB83557526, arrived dead at LAX on March 7, 2024. An email received from LACPHV
states, “The notes said the birds flew from Florida to Detroit, at which point one was shaking and the other had shallow
breathing and they needed to be warmed up. At some point they were put on a plane to LAX then arrived dead on arrival
(DOA).” The facility representative stated the flight was originally scheduled to connect through Atlanta but was re-
directed to Detroit. The Live Animal Shipper’s Certification document accepted at time of flight states the animals of this
consignment were in good health and condition.
Delta cargo personnel at LAX verified 2 Amazon parrots were found DOA on March 7, 2024. Although the 2 Amazon
parrots were showing signs of physical distress upon arrival to Detroit, airline personnel did not arrange for any needed
veterinary care, nor did they prevent the parrots from being transported to LAX in this condition. Failure to prevent the
transport of sick birds and those showing signs of physical distress may negatively affect the health and well-being of the
birds. Any person subject to the Animal Welfare regulations in this part and parts 1 and 2 of this subchapter may not
transport in commerce birds that are ill, injured, or in physical distress, except to receive veterinary care for the condition
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.165(c)  Critical
   
Care in transit. 
Delta Airlines personnel reported to a Los Angeles County Public Health Veterinarian (LACPHV) on March 8, 2024, that 2 
Amazon parrots, listed on AWB83557526, arrived dead at LAX on March 7, 2024. An email received from LACPHV 
states, “The notes said the birds flew from Florida to Detroit, at which point one was shaking and the other had shallow 
breathing and they needed to be warmed up. At some point they were put on a plane to LAX then arrived dead on arrival 
(DOA).” The facility representative stated the flight was originally scheduled to connect through Atlanta but was re-
directed to Detroit. The Live Animal Shipper’s Certification document accepted at time of flight states the animals of this 
consignment were in good health and condition.  
Delta cargo personnel at LAX verified 2 Amazon parrots were found DOA on March 7, 2024. Although the 2 Amazon 
parrots were showing signs of physical distress upon arrival to Detroit, airline personnel did not arrange for any needed 
veterinary care, nor did they prevent the parrots from being transported to LAX in this condition. Failure to prevent the 
transport of sick birds and those showing signs of physical distress may negatively affect the health and well-being of the 
birds. Any person subject to the Animal Welfare regulations in this part and parts 1 and 2 of this subchapter may not 
transport in commerce birds that are ill, injured, or in physical distress, except to receive veterinary care for the condition 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
